definition: to belong or be dedicated exclusively to/proprietary/private/personal
for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
category/genus (taxonomy)/family members/dependents/to belong to/subordinate to/affiliated with/be born in the year of (one of the 12 animals)/to be/to prove to be/to constitute
to join together/to fix one's attention on/to concentrate on

sentences.english: No more TPBs of the club comics.
sentences.chinese: 没有出版俱乐部专属漫画合订本的计划。

sentences.english: The company holds exclusive rights in the intellectual property connected with its goods and services.
sentences.chinese: 公司持有货物和服务知识产权的专属权。

sentences.english: Results:TLC method has a better separation and specificity.
sentences.chinese: 结果薄层色谱分离度较好，专属性强。

sentences.english: Validation criteria should include specificity, and intermediate precision.
sentences.chinese: 验证项目应当包括专属性和中间精密度。

sentences.english: It's a little exclusive just because you have to interview to get in.
sentences.chinese: 有一点点专属，因为要加入还要通过面试。

sentences.english: The provisions on the establishment and administration of special-purpose institutions will be formulated by the CIRC separately.
sentences.chinese: 专属机构的设立和管理，由中国保监会另行规定。

sentences.english: Firms gathered data slowly and patchily, through mechanisms not built for the purpose.
sentences.chinese: 企业从非专属渠道缓慢而零散的收集数据。

sentences.english: The idea that flirtation has become the sole province of females is erroneous;
sentences.chinese: 调情行为的理念已经成为女性专属的领域是不正确的。

sentences.english: Manicures and pedicures are for women.
It can be used for quality control of Carbamazepine tablets.
sentences.chinese: 本法准确可靠，专属性强，能更好地控制其质量。

sentences.english: Each cycle of magma movement has different characteristics and metallogenic specificity.
sentences.chinese: 各旋回的岩浆运动有著不同的特点和成矿专属性。

sentences.english: "Even I don't have my own desk, " says DeHart.
sentences.chinese: “就连我本人也没有自己专属的办公桌，”德哈特称。

sentences.english: Every decent technological meltdown deserves its own neologism
sentences.chinese: 每一次像样的技术性崩溃事件都应该有个专属新词。

sentences.english: The Connectivity Lounge brings together the convenience of an exclusive mobile office and an atmosphere of complete privacy.
sentences.chinese: 互联中心兼具移动办公室的便利和专属环境的幽谧。

sentences.english: All intellectual property rights associated with the goods remain the property of the seller.
sentences.chinese: 公司持有货物和服务知识产权的专属权。

sentences.english: Dedicate and mount a physical hard disk to each virtual machine.
sentences.chinese: 让每个虚拟机器都有专属的挂接实体硬碟。

definition: custom-made/made-to-order/to have something custom made/also written 定製|定制
unique and unmatched (idiom); unrivalled/nothing compares with it
to own exclusively/unique to/specific/there is only
to create/to build/to develop/to forge (of metal)
for use by the emperor/imperial/(derog.) in the pay of the ruler
